column1: Grass & grass-like cover - Medium quality 1 (ground cover)

column2: Indicate the lowest realistic value for each time step
column3: Indicate the highest realistic value for each time step
column4: Provide your best estimate of the value for each time step
column5: How confident are you that your interval, from lowest to highest, would capture the true value)

column1: Management scenario: Typical private land activities

column2: Site management is fairly consistent - what has survived generally continues to do so. There is a risk of declines and this is observed with a minority of sites, typically through unauthorised or inappropriate land use changes. A significant number of sites also improve through benign neglect as transition from production grazing to hobby farm use
We generally find a strong increase of groundcover in this scenario, however this is not the case with all sites (hence the lower bound)

There is no additional gain in the long term by more intensive management where a core base of native groundcovers is already present; this is more resilient than scalping and revegetating, so more expensive techniques deliver less result here (despite initial peak)
